newsitem.title: USA: Harvard given $25 mln by Bill Gates and colleague.
newsitem.headline: Harvard given $25 mln by Bill Gates and colleague.

text.p: Twenty years after he dropped out of Harvard University, Bill Gates and one of his colleagues from Microsoft Corp. donated $20 million to the school to build a computer sciences building, Harvard said Tuesday.
Gates and Steven Ballmer donated an additional $5 million to support research and endow a faculty chair for the department.

Harvard's most famous dropout, Gates left the university in his sophomore year to start the computer software company, where he currently serves as chairman. Ballmer, an executive vice president at Microsoft, graduated from Harvard in 1977 with a degree in applied mathematics.

"Universities have played a major role in the development of the Internet and many other important technologies," Gates said in a statement. "Steve and I are excited to help Harvard advance this program in ways that will contribute directly to the phenomenal innovation under way today in the information-technology field and to the close examination of its impact on society."

The new facility, which include classrooms, seminar rooms, offices, and laboratory space, will be named Maxwell Dworkin in honour of the donors' mothers, Mary Maxwell gates and Beatrice Dworkin Ballmer.
